summary: This bill, the "Ban on Inkless Directives and Executive Notarizations Act of 2025," seeks to amend Title 3 of the United States Code. It prohibits the delegation of Presidential functions, specifically the signing of engrossed bills, Executive orders, and pardons or commutations, to anyone other than the President. The bill also explicitly forbids the use of automated signing devices, such as autopens, for these purposes.  The bill further states that any previous actions violating this rule are null and void.
